diseases.remedy: Indian aloe (Qust Bahri) powdered, sometimes with myrrh and alum
diseases.method: Powder and treat in fresh water; inhalation/sniff (su'it) through nose while lying on back to induce sneezing and dry uvula
diseases.dose: Small pinch of prepared powder per use
diseases.timing: Twice daily or as indicated until inflammation subsides
diseases.source: Natural Healing with the Medicine of the Prophet — Aisha narration about 'uthra' (throat inflammation)
diseases.remedy_description: Indian costus (Qust) is a brown, knobbly aromatic root, bitter in taste and used as a powdered inhalant or remedy. More images: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Costus

diseases.remedy: Honey in warm water, rest, expectorant diet
diseases.method: Drink warm water sweetened with honey to loosen phlegm and soften stomach
diseases.dose: 1–2 tablespoons honey in 1 cup warm water; frequency per severity
diseases.timing: Often recommended on empty stomach or morning; repeat as needed
diseases.source: Natural Healing with the Medicine of the Prophet — honey uses
diseases.remedy_description: Honey mixed in warm water forms a sweet, aromatic drink that is smooth and viscous; used historically to soothe throats and ease coughs. More images: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Honey
